data.text: Pannier's Mount System Scratching the Paint of the Rack
I just switched to panniers, and their mounts are rubbing the rack. Within a week, the paint has rubbed off and they're scraping into the metal. Does anyone have a solution for this?
Duct tape
data.author: Anders Hansen

data.text: Tape it, solutions can be so easy sometimes.

data.author: Scott Jones

data.text: I use vulkband - I don't know what you call that tape that isn't sticky, but you stretch it and it sticks to itself forever rubberishly. When I had to big pannierclaws (or to thin tubing on my former rack I used a transparent petrol tube.
data.author: Anette Sidest√•l

data.text: Look into the root cause of this rubbing. I don't see a picture, but rubbing is always caused by relative movement of two parts. So you need to make sure any moving parts are so firmly attached to each other that they are absolutely tight and don't move. I have a Thule rear rack with Vaude panniers on it, attached to the rack by pannier clips on top and my nylon ties at the bottom. The Thule rack is firmly attached to the bike by the rack's fabric band fasteners. And it's a full suspension bike! Nothing rubs anything.
data.author: Ango Radus

data.text:
Ortleib and Deiter panniers have antiscratch insert / reducers available in different sizes thaat allow you to match the rack diameter. Check if reducers are available for your panniers they're demonstated at about 1m20s into this video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Alb4A8D6_co&ab_channel=DysonBikes
Ortlieb QL2.1 bicycle pannier bag fitting system

data.text: oh my goodness. I can't believe I didn't notice this. I have ortlieb panniers, and I took the spacers with me. So I've fitted them and it works perfectly! Thank you for mentioning this.

data.text: If the mounts are metal, did they come with plastic inserts?
data.author: Mark Perry

data.text: Easy solution is to tape pieces of old innertube where the mounts touch the frame. I also wrap the pannier frame where the top mounts are to stop the panniers from rattling.

data.text: A short length (~50mm) of braided hose tube works well - spliced along it's length to fit, cheap as chips & cable be cable tied on, available from most hardware / diy stores.
